title: Upanishad Ganga 52 Episodes 2012
description:
Upanishad Ganga is an 2012 Indian television drama series based on the message in the Upanishads, directed by Chandraprakash Dwivedi and produced by Chinmaya Mission (Chinmaya Creations). It started telecast from March 11, 2012 on DD National (DD1), has a total of 52 episodes based on the Upanishads highlighting the ideal thinking and empowerment provided by the Vedic society in India.[1][2][3] The series was conceptualised by Swami Tejomayananda the global head of Chinmaya Mission,[4] Dwiwedi is most known for his lead role in TV series, Chanakya (1991-1992), one of the cast is Abhimanyu Singh, who is playing 33 different roles in the series.[5]

Prior to its telecast the cast and director started a promotional tour across India to cities like Jaipur, Chandigarh, Delhi, Lucknow, Kolkata, Hyderabad, Mumbai and Bhopal.[2]

Plot
The serial-Drama revolves around the social lifestyles, customs and thinking from the Vedic Society and gives a touch of ethics which we should imply in our daily life.The program starts with an Upanishad-Chanting related to the topic of the drama and all the group of dramatists gathers for the chanting. The title song/verse of the serial is 15th verse of Ishopanishad-

Concept development
The Vedic Culture is introduced in the initial episodes (1-4). Then cultural values at the levels of the individual and the society are presented in the following 18 episodes (5-22). After, thus establishing the cultural basis and ethos, the entire Upanishadic Wisdom is then presented in the next 20 episodes (23Ã¢â‚¬â€œ42). The practical steps that could be taken to actualize this wisdom in one's life are then elaborated in the next nine episodes (43Ã¢â‚¬â€œ51). The last episode is an expression of gratefulness for this Wisdom which has made India proud, noble, and admired the world over.[7]
